news-item.title: National Gas in its biggest trailing week loss for 3 weeks
news-item.source: News Bites - Middle East and North Africa: Oman
news-item.text:
National Gas (MSM:NGCI), Oman's 2nd largest oil & gas company by market capitalisation, decreased 0.80 Baisa (or 0.8%) from its last traded date of March 12, 2014 to close at 99.20 Baisa. In the past week the shares have plummeted 12.6%, the biggest trailing week fall since February 20. Compared with the Muscat Securities Market Index which rose 8.5 points (or 0.1%) in the day, this represented a relative price change of -0.9%. To download our Detailed Research Report (PDF), giving comprehensive trading and background information on National Gas, please click http://www.buysellsignals.com/00105144174031483 Bearish SignalsSignificant Downtrend- The stock continues its significant downtrend.- The stock dropped on high volatility today.- Falls to Rises: in the past month the number of falls outnumbered rises 13:6 or 2.2:1.- The price plummeted 17.7% in the last month. Fundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Overvaluation:- Price/Earnings of 60 [29.1]. - Price/Sales of 0.8 [0.6]. We estimate National Gas stock is trading at a current year Price/Sales of 0.5 and a forward year Price/Sales of 0.3. - Return on Equity 5.7% [8.9%].- Return on Assets 0.7% [2.6%].- Return on Capital Employed 2.9% [10.7%].Other Bearish Signals:- Total Liabilities/ EBITDA of 29.7 is more than or equal to 5, this compares unfavourably with the Joseph Piotroski benchmark of 5. - As per the Du Pont analysis, Return on Equity is less than stellar at 5.7%. This is computed as net profit margin of 1.4% times asset turnover [sales/assets] of 0.53 times leverage factor [total assets/shareholders' equity] of 7.6. Also, this has deteriorated from 14.8% last year.
Bullish Signals- The present value of OMR1,000 (PV1000) invested one year ago in National Gas is OMR1,837, for a capital gain of OMR837. Oversold/Bullish/Support Signals- The stock is oversold according to the Williams % R indicator of -84.8, suggesting the price is close to its 14-day low of 96.0 Baisa.- Tobin's Q Ratio, defined as MCap divided by Total Assets, is 0.4. Compared with the rest of the market the stock is undervalued.- Net profit margin has averaged 5.2% in the last 3 years. This is better than the sector average of 3.3% and suggests a high margin of safety.- Net Profit margin has shown signs of recovery in recent quarters.[Quarter ended, all figures in %] - Revenue growth rate is positive and has seen consecutive rises in recent years.[Year ended, all figures in %] NoteVolume: there were 28,540 shares worth OMR28,312 (US$73,546) traded. The volume was 0.5 times the average trading of 59,752 shares. - National Gas is at a discount of 39.9% to its 12-month high of OMR1.65 on 30 Jan, 2014. It is also at a premium of 143.7% to the 12-month low of 40.70 Baisa on 19 Sep, 2013.
